strong.span: Welcome to Hawkins County Schools New Web Site

strong.em: Digital Resources for Teachers and Families

li.a: NE Testing Sites Flyer Comm. Partner April 2020.pdf
NE Testing Sites Flyer Spanish April 2020.pdf

p.span: Hawkins County Schools is in the process of adopting English Language Arts textbooks for the upcoming six years. You may access information about the textbooks up for adoption at the following website:https://www.tn.gov/education/textbook-services/textbook-adoption-process.html.

Our district has a committee of over sixty educators who have been carefully reviewing each of the state approved textbooks over the past months. In addition, all Hawkins County ELA teachers have been given the opportunity to view the books and to offer input. If you have comments concerning the textbooks or would like to make an appointment to view the textbooks in person, please contact Beth Holt (beth.holt@hck12.net), Lori Allen (lori.allen@hck12.net), or Thomas Floyd (thomas.floyd@hck12.net). We would like to thank the committee for their input and diligent work around this important decision.

img.alt: Next Scheduled Board of Education Meeting
img.title: Next Scheduled Board of Education Meeting

br.p: HAWKINS COUNTY SCHOOLS AND GAGGLE PARTNER TO IMPLEMENT SAFETY MANAGEMENT FOR G SUITE
Cherokee High School and Volunteer High School competed and places in band Clinics

Students from Cherokee and Volunteer bring the CTE on Wheels program out to the elementary and middle schools. Students will have an opportunity to learn about our CTE programs from high school students who can show them some of the awesome things they are working on in their respective programs!
Ballad Health presented a webinar on Tuesday regarding what they are seeing with this year’s influenza cases and their recommendations to the school systems in our region.

div.span: It is the policy of the Hawkins County School System not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability in its educational programs or employment policies as required by Title VI and VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the Equal Pay Act of 1963, Title IX (1972 Educational Amendments), Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, and the Americans with Disabilities Act.
